H0.text: Meters are the most appropriate unit of measure for students measuring the growth rate of basil plant roots in three different water solutions, with measurements recorded every other day for eight weeks.

H1.text: Centiliters is the most appropriate unit of measure for the investigation where students compared the growth rate of basil plant roots in three different water solutions, recording measurements every other day for eight weeks.

H2.text: Millimeters are the most appropriate unit of measure for the investigation in which students compared the growth rate of basil plant roots in three different water solutions, recording measurements every other day for eight weeks.

H3.text: Liters are the most appropriate unit of measure for the investigation in which students compared the growth rate of basil plant roots in three different water solutions, recording measurements every other day for eight weeks.

A4.text: On a standard metric ruler, the smallest divisions are typically millimetres

A5.text: Digital calipers often measure to 0.01 mm accuracy
